title: The Amazing Race Australia has cast its first-ever Indigenous couple
text:
They're the deadly duo from the Top End.

And they're hoping to make their two-year-old son proud when they set off to conquer The Amazing Race Australia.

On Wednesday, the reality show's official Instagram page announced its latest competitors, Indigenous couple Jasmin and Jerome.

Deadly and loving it! Jasmin (left) and Jerome (right) from the Top End will join The Amazing Race Australia as the show's first-ever Indigenous couple

The post was tagged: 'Hoping to do their two-year-old son proud, this adrenaline junkie/lawyer pair are passionate about setting a good example for other young Indigenous Australians'.

In the snap, the attractive couple are beaming from ear to ear.

Jasmin is seen wearing black athleisurewear, while Jerome is in an always-fashionable simple black T-shirt.

Too cute: The proud couple share an adorable two-year-old son Jerome Jnr. Pictured

Both tops are proudly emblazoned with the distinctive Australian Aboriginal Flag, which was designed by artist Harold Thomas in 1971 as a symbol of the Aboriginal land rights movement.

According to 10 Daily, Jasmin is extremely organised and very well planned.

Jerome, on the other hand, loves adrenaline, and isn't phased about jumping out of planes, but his tummy might be turn out to be his downfall.

'I think the eating challenges might be a weakness,' the proud Wadjigan man admitted.

Jasmin, a Bindal and Gunditjmara woman, added: 'Jerome and I have achieved a lot in our respective 30 years and we want to challenge the sometimes negative portrayal of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.'

The new season of The Amazing Race Australia will be hosted by Beau Ryan.

The reality show features 11 teams racing across three continents in a bid to win $250,000 in prize money.

The Amazing Race Australia premieres October 28 at 7.30pm on Channel Ten
description: They're the deadly duo from the Top End.
authors: Shannon Shipley For Daily Mail Australia
